column4: Why can't I run VirtualBox? It gives me this message when I try to run it: Could not load the settings file '/home/knoxville/.VirtualBox/VirtualBox.xml'.
ls -l /home/knoxville/.VirtualBox/VirtualBox.xml
ls -ld /home/knoxville/.VirtualBox/
the file is there..
owner/group?
trying to change the rights atm
didnt work.. it still gives me: Could not load the settings file '/home/knoxville/.VirtualBox/VirtualBox.xml'.
why don't you provide us with the info needed to help?
recreate your VMs  with the new version
recreate my VMs? So I have to reinstall 8 Operating Systems? :)
why? the images are fine, just the seting-files have to be recreated
so I can delete the VirtualBox.xml file and it will create a new one?
but maybe ask at #vbox, the might have a better solution
try with renameing that file 1st
thanks alot
create it first
you want to try nx if you want the full desktop
nx?
freenx, something like vnc over ssh
alternative  here http://knol.google.com/k/dirk-h-schulz/xdmcp-over-ssh/2bcee0ik2900p/16#
ssh -X/Y isn't intended to forward a desktop, its just for the use of single X-apps
for freenx see https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FreeNX
